Category:
Report metadata
This should include all metadata related to the test itself, points that are of responsibility of the laboratory. 
This metadata gives the report context.

This is the sample metadata. There may be different types of sample metadata such as:
- Measured properties (e.g. moisture content, mass)
- Reported properties (e.g. ore type, lithology, location)
Note that for "Reported properties", a lab will only report back what they have received from a mining company.

Parameter description: Grades of feed sample (e.g., %Cu, g/t Au)
To be discussed: I think this should be part of the mineralogy report of the sample, otherwise it will be repretitive. But we need to "draw the line" together. The same applies to the product grades

Category:
The test will have Parameters recorded when it is run. Parameters are the controlled input variables key to the test procedure that give context and meaning to the test results. The Parameters of interest will vary based on the type of test. 
May be defined (e.g. target pH) or observed (measured pH).
Parameter description: Type of Lixiviant (e.g., H?SO?, NaCN, NH?OH)
Pressure (ambiant or controlled for autoclave tests)
Leach Vessel Type (e.g., beaker, rolling bottle)
Agitation Speed / Type (rpm, mechanical or magnetic)
Permeability/Packing (Variable along the column or constant?)

Parameter description: Reagent addition type (e.g., pH modifier, oxidizing agent, surfactants)

Category:
For each stage, Parameters (controlled input variables) may be recorded, such as the observed/measured conditions or the reagents added.
There may be a single record for Stage Parameters, or there may be a series of records (where data is recorded on a time interval or during/after cycles).
Parameter description: Reagent addition concentration (e.g., pH modifier, oxidizing agent, surfactants)
Reagent addition volume (e.g., pH modifier, oxidizing agent, surfactants)
Stage time (e.g., sampling interval / pre-conditioning time)
pH of Solution (measured at the beginning of each stage)

Category: Measured/Observed/Controlled outcomes from a test stage. There may be a single record for Stage Outputs, or there may be a series of records (where data is recorded on a time interval or during/after cycles).
Parameter description: Redox Potential Eh (measured at the beginning of each stage)
Temperature (measured at the beginning of each stage)
Child sample IDs (to be forwarded to analytics, for example)

Test | Outputs
